page.title: 17PORTHLEVEN COUNCIL BADGE
page.content: The Town Council badge is split into quarters by an anchor. In one quarter is the sun. It is on a black background. A fishing boat is in the next square. On the square below is St. Peter standing at the edge of the sea holding a fishing net with two fish and one crab that have just dropped out. In the fourth square is the clock tower with three black faces and one white. This is the Bickford-Smith Institute. Round the Institute is a cobbled stone road. The pier is pointing out towards the sea which is white with black waves. Round the outside of the badge is a rope which goes through a little round circle at the top of the anchor.
